alex.mojaki.boxes.utils

Class InstanceStore<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • alex.mojaki.boxes.utils.InstanceStore<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of class being stored

    public abstract class InstanceStore<T>
extends Object
    A helper class for caching instances of objects based on constructor arguments in a thread-safe manner.

    Override the getNew(Object...) method to create a new instance, typically by calling a constructor. Then then get(Object...) method will only return a new instance when it encounters new arguments. Otherwise it will return a previously created instance.

    Usage of this class will look something like this: 

     
 public class T {

     private static final InstanceStore<T> INSTANCE_STORE = new InstanceStore<T>() {
         public T getNew(Object... args) {
             return new T((X) args[0], (Y) args[1]);
         }
     };

     private T(X x, Y y) {
         // constructor here...
     }

     public static T getInstance(X x, Y y) {
         return INSTANCE_STORE.get(x, y);
     }
 }

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get(Object... args)
      Get an instance using the given arguments.
      abstract T getNew(Object... args)
      Override this method to return a new instance of the class of interest using the given arguments.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InstanceStore

        public InstanceStore()

    • Method Detail

      • getNew

        public abstract T getNew(Object... args)
        Override this method to return a new instance of the class of interest using the given arguments. This usually means calling a constructor.

      • get

        public T get(Object... args)
        Get an instance using the given arguments. If the arguments are new then a new instance will be returned via getNew(Object...). Otherwise a cached instance will be returned.
